actions.recommendation: You may have subclinical hypothyroidism - this needs to be followed up in the new year. If TSH is still raised, consider thyroid hormone replacement.
As discussed you do need to follow up in the new year to manage your glucose and insulin levels. It is likely that you have type 2 diabetes.
Pay close attention to your diet. Significantly reduce your carbohydrate intake, eliminate sugar from your diet and reduce your alcohol intake.

Supplements recommended: Vitamin D 5000 iu daily, Metagenics Phytomulti to lower homocysteine and support thyroid function, Good quality Omega 3, Berberine - to lower blood glucose and insulin levels and help with possible fatty liver.
